item.title: She Was Ready to Have Her 15th Child. Then Came the Felony Charges.
item.description: MaryBeth Lewis’s desire to be a new mom again, at 65 years old, led to a custody battle like no other.

item.title: Everyone Hates ‘Friend,’ the A.I. Necklace. But the A.I. Isn’t the Problem.
item.description: A wearable companion is a brilliant idea — in theory.

item.title: The Soothing British Radio Show That Blew My Mind — and Put Me Right to Sleep
item.description: Melvyn Bragg talked to academics who dedicated their lives to studying very specific things. After more than 1,000 episodes, there’s still so much to learn.

item.title: The Weeknight-Friendly Dish That’s Good With Just About Anything
item.description: Mushy peas, a British classic, are perhaps the ultimate easy side.

item.title: Should I Warn Home Buyers About the Wailing Neighbor?
item.description: I don’t want to prevent a current neighbor from selling, but it feels as if disclosure should take place.

item.title: Is a Really Big Half-Sandwich Technically a Whole Sandwich?
item.description: A ruling on a serving-size dispute.

item.title: Fox News Wanted Greg Gutfeld to Do This Interview. He Wasn’t So Sure.
item.description: The pugnacious conservative late-night host on his “hierarchy of smears” and the risks of being a scold.

item.title: After 35 Years, Do I Still Have to Cook for My Husband?
item.description: I simply am not interested in food labor for another 25 years.

item.title: The N.B.A.’s TV Broadcasts Have Lost Their Spark. Can We Learn to Love Them Again?
item.description: Pro basketball has returned to NBC, its home during the glory days of the 1990s. But the sport and its audience have changed.

item.title: My Kids Are Becoming Adults. Can I Stop Hiding What I Think About Their Father?
item.description: This man has financially abused me and done everything in his power to undermine my career and my well-being.

item.title: Why Screaming Is All the Rage
item.description: It’s a practice with roots in Greek tragedy, which has a lot to teach us about the power — and limits — of raised voices.

item.title: What to Know About Teen Sexual Development and S.S.R.I.s
item.description: There is basically no research that looks at the impact of antidepressants on emerging sexuality. Here are the key things we do know.

item.title: These Pumpkin Mini Muffins Are the Perfect Fall Breakfast
item.description: Adapted from a school kitchen, they’re all comfort.

item.title: More Teens Are Taking Antidepressants. It Could Disrupt Their Sex Lives for Years.
item.description: Research on adults who take S.S.R.I.s shows they tamp down sexual desire. Why aren’t we studying what that could mean for adolescents who take them?
